resource_dependency.databaseSchema: CREATE TABLE species (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, common_name VARCHAR(255), scientific_name VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE, habitat TEXT, diet TEXT, conservation_status VARCHAR(100));

function: A frontend application that fetches all species biological data from backend APIs
static_description: The main page displays a list of species cards showing basic information such as name, image thumbnail (if available), and conservation status. Cards are arranged in a grid layout on desktop and stacked vertically on mobile devices.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a species card navigates to the detailed view page for that species.
Scrolling loads more items if pagination or infinite scrolling is enabled.

function: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: The server initializes connection to the PostgreSQL instance using provided credentials and exposes RESTful endpoints for CRUD operations related to species data.

resource_dependency.speciesTableDefinition: CREATE TABLE species (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, common_name VARCHAR(255), scientific_name VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE, habitat TEXT, diet TEXT, conservation_status VARCHAR(100));

function: Database schema design to store species biological information data
static_description: Defines the structure for storing species data with fields including id, common name, scientific name, habitat, diet, and conservation status.

function: Browse functionality to display lists of species with their biological information
static_description: Displays a paginated or infinitely scrollable list of species cards showing common name, scientific name, and brief habitat/diet info.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a card redirects to the species detail page.
Infinite scroll triggers loading additional pages when reaching near bottom.

function: Search functionality allowing users to find specific species or biological data
static_description: A prominent search bar at the top allows entering keywords. Search results appear dynamically below or redirect to a dedicated results page.

interaction_and_states.description: Pressing Enter submits the query via API call and updates displayed results.
Clicking the magnifying glass icon also submits the current input value.

resource_dependency.filterControlComponent: Dropdowns and checkboxes for selecting filters like habitat type, diet category, conservation status.

function: Filtering capabilities to narrow down species data based on various criteria
static_description: Side panel contains filter options grouped under collapsible sections. Options include habitat, diet, and conservation status.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a checkbox applies the filter immediately, updating the displayed list of species.
Hovering over filter labels shows tooltips explaining what they represent.

function: Responsive web design with linen as the base color and maroon for all UI components
static_description: All background elements use linen (#FAF0E6). All buttons, links, borders, and active states use maroon (#800000). Layout adapts to screen size using responsive CSS techniques.

function: Species detail pages displaying comprehensive biological information
static_description: Each detail page includes the full name, photo gallery, habitat, diet, behavior notes, and conservation status in clearly separated sections.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking images in the gallery opens them in lightbox mode.

function: Pagination or infinite scroll for browsing large datasets
static_description: Either numbered pagination controls appear at the bottom of lists, or an automatic loader appears during scroll-based navigation depending on implementation choice.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Next' or a page number fetches the corresponding dataset slice.
Approaching the end of the list automatically loads next set of items without user intervention.

resource_dependency.supportedParameters: { term: string, criteria: { habitat?, diet?, status? } }

function: API endpoints for retrieving species data with support for search and filter parameters
static_description: Endpoints accept GET requests with optional query parameters for searching and filtering, returning structured JSON responses containing matched records.

resource_dependency.filterPanelComponent: Collapsible side menu with multi-select dropdowns and checkboxes

function: User interface components for search input and filter controls
static_description: Top-aligned search bar spans across header. Left-side collapsible drawer houses filter controls accessible via toggle button.

interaction_and_states.description: Tapping the filter icon toggles visibility of the filter control panel.
Submitting a search term updates the main content area with filtered results.

function: Data management capabilities for adding and updating species information
static_description: Admin-accessible forms allow creating new entries or editing existing ones. Fields match those defined in the database schema.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking Submit sends validated form data to appropriate endpoint for creation or update.
Modifying any field enables the Save button which remains disabled until changes occur.
